name: places/ChIJAQBwtqVZwokRe5l2pazwrZc
formattedAddress: 30 W 26th St, New York, NY 10010, USA
adrFormatAddress: 30 W 26th St, New York, NY 10010-2079, USA

originalText.text:
I recently purchased a pair of men's dress boots from The Royale Leather, and I must say, my experience has been nothing short of disappointing. The product I received was a far cry from the sleek and polished pair depicted on the website.

First and foremost, the boots I received bore little resemblance to the ones showcased in the product images. The actual product looked cheap and lacked the sophisticated charm that initially drew me to make the purchase. The discrepancy between the advertised and actual appearance is not something I expected when spending my hard-earned money.

Moreover, the quality of the leather staining on the boots was abysmal. The leather appeared unevenly stained, with splotches and discolorations that gave the boots a distinctly subpar and unrefined appearance. I expected a premium feel, but what I got was more reminiscent of a rushed, low-quality manufacturing process.

To add insult to injury, the boots came with cloth laces instead of the promised leather laces. This detail may seem trivial, but it significantly impacts the overall aesthetic and perceived quality of the product. The cloth laces felt flimsy and only served to underscore the lack of attention to detail in the manufacturing process.

I reached out to customer service to express my dissatisfaction, but unfortunately, the response was slow and unhelpful. It's disheartening to see a company not take responsibility for misleading advertising and delivering a product that falls short of customer expectations.

In conclusion, I would strongly advise potential buyers to think twice before investing in these boots. The discrepancy between the advertised and actual product, combined with poor leather staining and the use of cloth laces, make these boots a regrettable purchase for anyone seeking a refined and high-quality pair of dress boots.

I bought the dress boots for $280 in Canadian dollars, and customer service informed me that I could receive a refund if I covered the shipping costs to send it back to their warehouse in Pakistan. However, when I visited the FedEx store to arrange the return, I was shocked to learn that the shipping fee would be a staggering $460 in Canadian dollars. This seems excessively high and unexpected!
